name: Stemilt Growers
notes: Largest fresh market sweet cherry shipper in the world. Family-owned since 1964. Signature varieties include Pi単ata, Honeycrisp, Gala, Pink Lady.

name: McDougall & Sons
notes: Founded 1976. 2,200 acres of orchards. Packs 260,000 bins of apples/pears and 11,000-12,000 tons of cherries. Exclusive rights to Ambrosia apple variety. Conventional and organic.

name: Borton Fruit
notes: Premium grower, packer, shipper. Located at 2550 Borton Road, Yakima, WA 98903. Phone: 509-966-3905

name: Allan Brothers
notes: Founded early 1900s. Over 100 years of operation. Cold/controlled atmosphere storage. 31 Allan Road, Naches, WA 98937. Phone: 509-653-2625

name: Domex Superfresh Growers
notes: Sixth generation family-owned. Exclusive grower of Autumn Glory速 apple. 151 Low Rd, Yakima, WA

name: Rainier Fruit Company
notes: Offers Envy, Jazz, and Pacific Rose varieties. 510 N. 7th, Brewster, WA 98812

name: Washington Fruit Growers
notes: Operating since 1916. Family-owned. Year-round supply of conventional and organic apples. State-of-the-art technologies.

name: Gebbers Farms
notes: Over a century of experience. One of the most trusted apple growers in the northwestern U.S.

name: Starr Ranch Growers
notes: Founded 1934. Leading fruit grower, packer, and shipper of Northwest-grown fruit.

name: CMI Orchards
notes: One of Washington's largest grower, packer, shipper. CMI Orchards and Daisy Girl Organics are #1 selling brands in the U.S.

name: Matson Fruit
notes: Over 100 years of experience. Renowned grower and distributor.

name: Chelan Fresh Marketing
notes: AltaFresh L.L.C. d/b/a Chelan Fresh Marketing. Top marketer providing 250,000+ boxes of fruit per week year-round.

name: Apple King
notes: Family owned since 1914. Conventional and organic fruit packer. Growing, packing, and shipping company.

name: Fowler Packing Company
notes: Established 1950. Parent company to Peelz Citrus, Samsons Grapes, G3 Development. 8570 S Cedar Ave, Fresno, CA

name: Bari Produce
notes: Founded ~1915. Stone fruit packed in premium BARI速 label. Extra large apricots from Panoche Hills micro-climate.

name: Trinity Fruit Company
notes: Family-owned grower, packer, shipper. 7571 N. Remington Ave, Suite 104, Fresno, CA 93711. Organic produce available.

name: Sunnyside Packing Company
notes: Third generation family owned and operated grower, packer, shipper of fresh fruits and vegetables.

name: Family Tree Farms
notes: Ranches in California, Mexico, and Peru. Focus on flavor, quality, integrity, and safety.

name: Giumarra Vineyards
notes: Family-owned for 80+ years. Premium California table grapes. P.O. Box 861449 Los Angeles, CA 90086. Phone: 213-627-2900

name: Pandol Bros Inc
notes: Leading producer for 70+ years. Grower-shipper and marketer. Imports/exports worldwide.

name: Delano Farms
notes: In production since 1991. Thousands of acres in San Joaquin, Coachella, and Mexico. Trademarked Pristine速 green seedless.

name: Four Star Fruit
notes: Since 1987. Campbell family owned for three generations. Fields in San Joaquin, Coachella, and Mexico. Organic and conventional.

name: Castle Rock Vineyards
notes: Vineyards in Coachella, Arvin, Bakersfield, Delano, Ducor, Lindsay, and Reedley. Sales staff at Delano cold storage.

name: Jasmine Vineyards
notes: Founded 1947 by Martin and Vincent Zaninovich. One of the largest table grape growers in the United States.

name: Anthony Vineyards Inc
notes: CFFA member. Shipper/Marketer member.

name: Lane Southern Orchards
notes: 100+ years in business. Started 1908. State-of-the-art facility completed 1990. Capacity: 1 million 25-lb cartons/season. Merged with Taylor Orchards 2018 to create largest peach/pecan operation in U.S.

name: Pearson Farm
notes: 100+ years growing on same land. 1,500 acres peaches, 2,000 acres pecans. Packing facility converted from old Zenith Consolidated School in 1975.

name: Dickey Farms
notes: One of four commercial peach farms in Georgia with Genuine Georgia Group relationship.

name: Fitzgerald Fruit Farms
notes: One of four commercial peach farms in Georgia with Genuine Georgia Group relationship.

name: IMG Citrus
notes: Citrus grower, importer, packer. New flagship facility 'Sweet Sixty' - integrated cold storage, packing, distribution hub.

name: Dundee Citrus Growers Association
notes: Established 1924. One of largest fresh fruit cooperatives in Florida. 10,000+ acres. Multiple citrus varieties.

name: Florida Classic Growers
notes: Co-operative owned by Dundee Citrus Growers Association. Fresh Florida citrus since 1924.

name: Hollieanna Groves
notes: Family owned and operated since 1954. Store and packing house in Maitland.

name: Countryside Citrus
notes: Family business for five generations. Leading grower, harvester, shipper of pristine Florida oranges and grapefruit.

name: Hyatt Fruit Company
notes: Shipping since 1946. 75+ years in business. Family owned and operated. Fresh fruit gift baskets and citrus candy.

name: Al's Family Farms
notes: Indian River grapefruit, Honeybells, Navel oranges, Temple oranges, Valencia oranges, tangerines fresh-picked.

name: Lone Star Citrus Growers
notes: Last independent family-owned Texas citrus packing house. Flowers family. 9625 N. Moorefield Rd., Mission, TX 78574. Phone: 956-424-3334. Ships Oct-Mar/Apr.

name: Rio Grande Juice Company
notes: Largest citrus juice manufacturer in Texas. Division of Wonderful Citrus since 2015. Processing plant in Mission.

name: Hudson River Fruit Distributors
notes: One of largest East Coast apple shippers. State-of-the-art equipment. Represents 10,000+ acres in NY State and New England.

name: George W. Saulpaugh & Son
notes: Wholesale apple grower, packer, shipper. ~20 varieties. 8 Controlled Atmosphere Storage Rooms for 150,000 bushels. GlobalGap and SCS GMP Certified.

name: Dressel Farms
notes: 300+ acres of apple trees, 20+ varieties. Annually packs and ships 100,000+ bushels (4M lbs) to east coast and overseas.

name: Apple Acres
notes: Family owned. Varieties include Rubyfrost, SnapDragon, Macintosh, Empire. Packs for other NY apple growers.

name: Fowler Farms
association: New York Apple Association, Crunch Time Apple Growers
notes: Sixth generation. Largest grower of Honeycrisp and SweeTango in NY State. 30+ varieties, 30 acres certified organic.

name: Applewood Fresh Growers LLC
notes: Aligns with: Applewood Orchards (Deerfield), Elite Apple Co. (Sparta), Michigan Apple Packers Cooperative (Sparta), Umlor Orchards (Conklin).

name: Ridgeking Apple Packing / Heeren Brothers
notes: Stores and packs apples for 75+ family-owned Michigan growers. Packs 20%+ of all fresh apples grown in Michigan. Joint venture with Applewood Orchards = All Fresh GPS.

name: Underwood Fruit and Warehouse Co
notes: Established early 1900s. Major packer in Hood River, The Dalles, White Salmon districts. Hood River/White Salmon pears renowned for appearance, flavor, storage.

name: Stadelman Fruit LLC
notes: Pear facility at 3366 Stadelman Dr, Hood River, OR 97031. Phone: 541-354-1224

name: Oregon Growers & Shippers LLC
notes: Farm Direct Foods from Pacific Northwest. 508 Oak Ave, Hood River, OR 97031.

name: Pearl's Place Fruit / Viewmont Orchards
notes: Established 1901 by Walter Wells. 500+ acres. Pack and ship under Viewmont Orchards label.

name: Diamond Fruit Growers
association: Columbia Gorge Fruit Growers, Northwest Horticultural Council
notes: Full member of NHC. Export Trade Certificate of Review holder.

name: Rice Fruit Company
notes: Largest apple-packing facility in Eastern half of U.S. Founded 1913 by Arthur Rice. Receives/stores/packs 1M+ boxes annually for 40+ farm families.

name: Bear Mountain Orchards
notes: Family owned and operated for 75+ years. Grower, packer, shipper. Specialize in fresh, local, safe produce. Potato Road near Aspers.

name: Associated Citrus Packers Inc
notes: 48 years in business. 2 W 6th St, Yuma, AZ 85364. Wholesale fruits and vegetables, frozen foods.

name: Limoneira Company
notes: Citrus shipper in Yuma County.

name: Mission Citrus
notes: Citrus shipper in Yuma County.

name: Sun Pacific
notes: 600,000 sq ft packing facility. Ships 70M+ boxes annually from 30,000 acres. Brands: Cuties, Mighties, Air Chief. Sales office in Pasadena.

name: Wonderful Citrus Packing LLC
source: Wonderful Citrus website - USDA NOP certified
notes: America's largest integrated citrus grower/packer/shipper. World's largest citrus packinghouse (size of 7 football fields). Processes 26M+ cartons annually. Additional facility at 1701 S Lexington St. Brand: Halos mandarins.

name: Grimmway Farms Inc.
notes: Headquarters in Bakersfield. One of world's largest carrot producers. 60,000+ acres under cultivation, 50,000+ acres organic. 19 facilities total across CA, CO, FL, GA, NV, OR, WA.

name: Church Brothers Farms
address: 19065 Portola Drive, Suite C, Salinas, CA 93908
notes: Founded 1999. Vertically integrated grower-processor. State-of-the-art processing plant (True Leaf Farms). Acquired Mann Packing Dec 2025 including 200,000 sq ft Gonzales facility.

name: Tanimura & Antle Corporation
notes: Largest independent lettuce grower/distributor in US. 40,000+ acres in CA/AZ. Founded 1982. Packing facility in Spreckels, CA. Additional 14-acre hydroponic greenhouse in Livingston, TN.

name: Mann Packing (acquired by Church Brothers 2025, formerly Fresh Del Monte)
source: Fresh Del Monte / Church Brothers acquisition news
notes: 5 facilities across CA. 200,000 sq ft fully automated Gonzales facility (2021). 160,000 sq ft production/cold storage, 40,000 sq ft offices. Acquired by Church Brothers Dec 2025.

name: Oregon Berry Packing, Inc.
address: 6000 SW Minter Bridge Rd, Hillsboro, OR 97123
source: Oregon Berry Packing website - ODA Korea Export Program
notes: Founded 1948. Family-owned, 70+ years experience. Certified Organic, FDA registration (FDA3010063). Supplies buyers worldwide.

name: Naumes, Inc.
notes: One of largest family-owned pear growers in US. Home office in Medford handles marketing/sales for OR, WA, CA. Started as WWII veteran packing house. Varieties: Anjou, Bosc, Comice.

name: Rio Fresh, Inc.
notes: Founded 1970. One of oldest family farming/packing operations in Rio Grande Valley. Primus-GFS certified packing facility on-farm. GAP certified, PrimusGFS audited.

name: Growers Select Produce Inc.
notes: Founded 1987 by Bob Dyer. Rio Grande Valley native. Third-party certified farms and packing facilities. Family-owned and operated.

name: J&D Produce
notes: One of Texas' largest fresh vegetable growers. Large packing and shipping facility. Thousands of acres throughout lower Rio Grande Valley.

name: Frontera Produce
notes: Grower, shipper, packer. Specializes in Rio Grande Valley produce and imports from Mexico. Focus on locally produced onions and imported chiles.

name: South Georgia Pecan Company
notes: Founded 1913 as small pecan shelling plant by Pearlman family. Owned by Worn Family since 2015. Expanded Eastern Production Facility plus El Paso, TX facility.

name: Sunnyland Farms
notes: 1,700-acre pecan farm purchased by Will Willson in 1928. Kosher certified (Atlanta Kashruth Commission): Mammoth/Junior Halves, Large/Small Pieces.

name: Farm Pak / Barnes Farming
notes: Facilities in Spring Hope and Benson, NC. Multiple storage facilities in eastern NC. 4 packing lines. 20 truckloads refrigeration capacity. 2M bushel temperature-controlled storage. One of most modern vegetable packing firms in US.

name: Boyette Brothers Produce
notes: Sweet potato packing house with 3 loading docks. 2 dedicated packing lines (stainless steel and organic). Operates 6 days/week. One of first NC sweet potato pack houses with stainless steel line.

name: Scott Farms
notes: 60,000 sq ft packing and shipping facility opened 2015. Sizes potatoes and packages to retailer/restaurant/foodservice preferences for each country.

name: Millstream Farms
notes: Grower, packer, shipper of NC sweet potatoes. Owned and managed by Chancy family in eastern NC.

name: B & B Produce
notes: Locally family-owned grower, packer, shipper. Serves wholesale, retail, foodservice, processing markets. USDA Harmonized GAP, Global GAP, GRASP certified.

name: Riveridge Produce Marketing
notes: Received $100K MDARD grant for weigher/batcher on cherry packing line in Grant, MI. Creates efficiencies for more accurate weight packing.

name: A.L. Johnson & Sons, Inc.
notes: Received $100K MDARD grant for packing/sorting equipment and second packing line in Leroy, MI facility. Generates 6 full-time jobs.

name: Driscoll's, Inc.
notes: Headquarters and R&D in Watsonville. 56 cooling/distribution sites in North/South America. Hand-picked and field-packed (except some blueberries). Santa Maria distribution facility. Operations on 5 continents, 115,000+ farm workers.

name: Fresh Del Monte Produce Inc.
source: Fresh Del Monte website - multiple states
notes: Vertically integrated global producer. 34 facilities in North America. Tricont Trucking/Logistics network. 13 owned vessels. Acquired Mann Packing 2018 (sold to Church Brothers 2025).

name: Peterson Groves
notes: Family owned since 1913, Indian River County 'World's Finest Citrus', prize-winning citrus

name: Schacht Groves
notes: Family owned since 1950, Indian River groves, FedEx shipping to USA/Canada, shipping included in price

name: Bee Heaven Farm / Redland Organics
notes: Multi-farm CSA since 2002, Nov-April season, certified organic, historic Redland district

name: Three Sisters Farm
notes: Working natural farm, year-round organic produce, agritourism destination in historic Redland

name: Pernas Groves
notes: Small family farm since 1975, historic Redland farming community, tropical south Florida

name: Tropical Acres Farms
notes: Retail & wholesale, farm stand, ships nationwide (not to CA/HI), 70+ mango varieties

name: Fairchild Farm
notes: 20-acre working farm, world's largest mango collection, farm-to-table delivery

name: Bland Farms
notes: Vidalia sweet onion specialist, direct-to-consumer shipping

name: McLain Farms
notes: Multi-generation farm in Lyons GA, award-winning Vidalia onions, ships from Georgia fields

name: A&M Farms
notes: Family owned 30+ years, ships to lower 48 states, Vidalia onion specialist

name: Shuman Farms
notes: Official Sweet Onion of UGA & Georgia Southern, dedicated to highest quality sweet onions

name: Burton Brooks Orchard Corporation

name: Southern Grace Farms
notes: Diverse fruit production, u-pick and farm stand sales

notes: Gift shop, concessions, birthday parties, school tours

name: Fisher's Orchard
notes: Since 1930, u-pick Friday-Sunday 9am-7pm in season, opens late June

name: Chappell Farms
notes: Since 1927, 98+ years, roadside stand 10-6pm, u-pick 7-6pm, cling/semi-free/freestone varieties

notes: Since 1916, 1,000+ acres, 50+ peach varieties, bakery, ice cream shop, agritourism events

name: Chattooga Belle Farm
notes: U-pick peaches early July, distillery on-site, camping, events, near hiking trails

name: St. Julien Plantation
notes: Family-run 100+ years, June-mid August, Mon-Sat 8am-6pm, Norris family

notes: April-August & October, 8am-6pm, strawberries April-June, peaches June-August

name: Windy Hill Farm
notes: Grass-fed Black Angus, meat goats, heritage vegetables, cut flowers

name: Growing Green Family Farms
notes: Advanced hydroponics, year-round production, no pesticides/herbicides/GMO

name: Barefoot Farms of Belton
notes: Naturally grown/chemical-free, raw milk, raw honey, fresh produce and eggs

name: Dempsey Farms
notes: 60 years, strawberries in April, seasonal produce, near Hunting Island State Park

name: Drawdy Farms
notes: Year-round farm stand, locally grown fruits and vegetables, family-owned

name: Okatee River Farms
notes: Small family farm, local produce, 1/2 mile from Hwy 278

name: Spade & Clover Gardens
notes: 12-acre Johns Island farm, 11+ years operation, vibrantly-hued vegetables

name: Freeman Produce
notes: Johns Island farm, seasonal vegetables

name: Sandhills Farm to Table Cooperative
notes: Multi-farm CSA, co-op owned by farmers/consumers/staff, 20+ local farmers, mid-April to mid-November

name: Riley's Ranch
notes: 175-acre family farm, Shorthorn & Black Angus cattle, heritage chickens, sustainable farming

name: Hickory Nut Gap Farm
notes: 100% grassfed beef, pastured pork & chicken, available by cut/bulk/CSA

name: Hominy Valley Farms
notes: Multi-generational family farm, natural beef on pasture, pastured broiler chickens, CSA program

name: Fickle Creek Farm
notes: Diversified small-scale farm, farm fresh veggies and meats

name: Harland's Creek Farm
notes: Certified organic, Alston-Degraffenried House (national historic site) on property

name: Greene's Blueberry Patch
notes: 235 bushes, natural growing, ripens mid-July to end August, picnic area

name: Avery Farms
notes: U-pick June-first frost, ciders/syrups/jams/jellies/vinaigrettes from farm fruits

name: Brushy Mountain Berry Farm
notes: Mountain backdrop, wild blackberries, farm-fresh eggs, seasonal produce, jams, syrups, baked goods

name: The Berry Farm
notes: Madison County, black raspberries June, blackberries/blueberries July, red raspberries August

name: Pilot Mountain Fresh Berries
notes: No pesticides, u-pick Mon-Fri, pre-picked Wed-Fri 9am-3pm, snacks/refreshments

name: Muzzarelli Farms
notes: Organic sweet potatoes, NC retail & wholesale, state vegetable of NC

name: Sullivan Farms
notes: 500 acres Covington sweet potatoes, hand-picked, locally grown, $18/40lb box

name: Strawberries on 903
notes: NC Certified Roadside Farm Market, pre-picked & u-pick strawberries, cut flowers, plants

name: Underwood Pecan Farm
notes: Since 1980s, Pecan Barn farm stand, orchards in Summerdale & Foley, shelled/unshelled/roasted/coffee/pie

name: B & B Pecan Company
notes: Family owned since 1956, 69 years, 'Direct from the farm. Because we ARE the farm.' 13 candied varieties

name: Bayou Pecan Company
notes: Family owned, multi-generational, Mississippi Sound location, North America's only native nut

name: Price Pecan Farm
source: Alabama pecan directory / Sweet Grown Alabama
notes: Family owned since mid-1970s, SE Baldwin County near Perdido Bay, open Mon-Sat year-round

name: Futral Farms
notes: 11 pecan varieties, East Alabama's premier pecan grower

name: 1818 Farms
notes: Historic village (pop. 58), Babydoll Southdown sheep, Nubian goat, heritage animals, 3 acres

name: Reeves Farm
notes: Land settled 1835, peach orchards since 1959, 4 generations 60+ years

name: LouAllen Farms
notes: Family-owned, strawberry/peach specialty, vegetable plants, seasonal produce

name: Esneul Farms
notes: Grass-fed Black Angus beef shares, all steers born & raised on farm

name: Shipshape Urban Farms
notes: 52 weeks/year production, hydroponic methods, upcycled shipping containers & greenhouses

name: Weeks Bay Plantation
notes: One of largest u-pick blueberry farms in Alabama, 12+ acres, pursuing USDA organic

name: Hickman's Farm
notes: North Alabama & South Tennessee, free-range eggs, 1-acre garden, homemade pickled products

name: Flying S Land & Livestock
notes: Family-owned, 100% grass-fed & finished Black Angus beef, Katahdin sheep breeding stock

name: Duncan Farms
notes: 60-acre permaculture family farm near Huntsville, sustainable practices

name: Wonderful Citrus
note: 75 years experience, largest citrus grower in America

name: Jim Durbin Farms
notes: One of the five largest peach growers in Alabama. Only large-scale peach packaging operation in the state. Ships Sunshine brand peaches to major wholesalers including Walmart, Bruno's, and Winn-Dixie. On-site packing shed with processing and packing capability. About 600 acres of fruit. Ships throughout eastern United States.

name: Bentley Farms
notes: One of the five largest peach growers in Alabama. Packs and ships produce for out-of-state sale. Located at 20466 US Highway 31 South, Thorsby, AL. Commercial packinghouse operation.

name: Culp Fruits
notes: One of the five largest peach growers in Alabama. Charles Culp began growing peaches in 1951. Now farms 100 acres of orchards. Commercial packing operations. Located at 11602 County Road 51, Exit 219 off I-65 in Jemison.

name: Sirmon Farms (Sweet Potato Processing Facility)
notes: One of the largest sweet potato processing facilities in the South. Family-run for over 5 generations, began in early 1900s. GAP Certified. Over 4,500 acres in Baldwin County. Modern processing: washer, sorting conveyors, grading line. Packs in forty-pound boxes. Wholesale distribution to grocery store warehouses and restaurants. Hours: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm, closed weekends.

name: Wildfork Blueberries
notes: The largest commercial wholesale blueberry farm in the State of Alabama. 60-acre farm. Wholesale distributor. Mailing address: 30530 Middle Creek Cir, Spanish Fort, AL 36527. Physical address: 3070 Hammac Rd, Brewton, AL 36426. Sales team available through website contact form.

name: Regional Produce Distributors, LLC
notes: Alabama's premier foodservice distributor. 30,000 square foot state-of-the-art facility. Located at 624 16th Avenue West, Birmingham, AL 35204. Serves foodservice industry. Alternative phone: 800-726-0711. Hours: 4am-3pm daily.

name: Forestwood Farm Inc
notes: Family-owned wholesale produce distributor. Started as poultry farm in Dora, AL. Now serves three-fourths of Alabama. Two main warehouses: Birmingham (4101 Coalburg Road, P.O. Box 310728) and Huntsville (256-536-9083). Serves restaurants, schools, military facilities across Southeast. Also has Jackson, TN location (731-513-5353).

name: Forestwood Farm (Huntsville Location)
notes: Regional distribution warehouse for Forestwood Farm. Located at 2105 Langford Ave. NW, Huntsville, AL 35807. Serves restaurants, schools, military facilities and other institutional buyers across Southeast.

name: Peach Park
notes: Family-owned and operated business opened in 1984. Farm market that grows own peaches and produce. Also purchases and sells products from local farmers. Located at 2300 7th Street South, Clanton, AL 35046. Includes barbecue restaurant, bakery, gift shop, boutique. Open seasonally Presidents' Day through Christmas. Hours: Mon-Fri 10am-5pm, Sat-Sun 10am-6pm.

name: Reeves Peach Farm
notes: Historic farm settled in 1835 by Thomas 'Jack' Reeves. Located at 334 Highway 36 E, Hartselle, AL 35640. Large variety of crops with special focus on peaches. Hours: Mon-Sat 9am-6pm, Sun 12pm-6pm.

name: First Fruit Farms Inc
notes: Founded in 2002. Located at 4898 Valleydale Rd, Birmingham, AL 35242. Contact: Randy Griffin. Estimated annual revenue $391,994. Approximately 3 employees.

name: Muzzarelli Farms (Curing/Packing Facility for Sweet Potatoes)
notes: New Jersey-based company with sweet potato packing operations serving Alabama. 20,000 sq. ft. packing facility capable of processing 20 cases per minute during peak operations. Certified Organic sweet potatoes selected, planted, sorted, sized, and packed by hand. Uses environmentally controlled curing facility. Address: 3460 Oak Road, Vineland, NJ 08360. Fax: 856-692-9007. Serves Alabama and numerous other US states.

name: Oakes Farms (Flat Rock, Alabama Operation)
notes: Oakes Farms expanding farming operations in Alabama. New farm operation and facility in Flat Rock, Alabama as part of becoming a 52-week Grower, Packer, and Shipper. Company headquarters: Naples, FL. Contact main office for Flat Rock facility details.

name: Alabama Sweet Potato Growers Association
notes: Industry organization representing collective farmers, packers, shippers with vested interest in sweet potato industry from Alabama and Tennessee. Works closely with Auburn University Horticulture Research and Experiment Station and Alabama Ag and Industries.

name: Alabama Fruit and Vegetable Growers Association (AFVGA)
notes: Trade organization promoting, advancing, and protecting growing, harvesting and marketing of fruits and vegetables. Located at 2108 East South Boulevard, Montgomery, AL 36116. Email: bthaxton@alfafarmers.org. Represents growers throughout Alabama producing specialty crops.

name: Kimball & Thompson Produce Company
notes: Major produce distributor with 22,055 sq ft warehouse in Lowell. Additional facilities in Oklahoma City (9,000 sq ft) and North Little Rock (10,000 sq ft). Operates Monday-Friday 7am-4pm CST. Holds $165 million military and school supply contracts. Five-generation family business.

name: Matthews Ridgeview Farms
notes: Largest grower/packer/shipper of sweet potatoes in Arkansas. State-of-the-art automated packing facility with electronic sizing line. Warehouse facility employs 80+ workers. Cold storage for entire crop. Sells over 1 million bushels annually to major retailers. Year-round supply for retail and wholesale. Seasonal shipping starts mid-to-late September. Family-owned with 100+ years history, operating since 2006 as Matthews Ridgeview Farms.

name: Proffer Wholesale Produce
notes: Operating 50+ years with farm and cold storage facility in Crossett. Full-service packinghouse in Park Hills, Missouri for custom packaging. Harvest season May-October. Seven-day availability. Sales representatives available 7am-5pm. Email: tiffany@profferproduce.com

name: Barnhill Orchards
notes: Family-owned sustainable farm established in 1980 by retired Air Force Lt. Col. Bob Barnhill. Hand-picked and hand-sorted produce for quality assurance. Strawberries available April, followed by blackberries, blueberries, peaches, then watermelons and cantaloupes in summer. On-farm sales Thursday-Sunday 9am-5:30pm. Email: barnhillorchards@aol.com

name: Arkansas Natural Produce
notes: Year-round greenhouse facility specializing in salad greens with seasonal vegetables. In business since 1988. Delivers to Little Rock and Hot Springs markets year-round. Over 50,000 sq ft of heated greenhouse space. Owners: Jay and Deanna Fulbright.

name: Peebles Organic Farms LLC
notes: 800-acre organic vegetable farm. USDA Organic certified. Retail and wholesale operations. Season: July-November. Processes pumpkins and produces certified organic edamame and green beans. Also operates Peebles Farm with corn maze and U-pick attractions.

name: Liberty Fruit Company
region: Midwest distribution (AR, IL, IA, KS, MO, NE, OK, SD)
notes: Founded 1965. Acquired by Russ Davis Wholesale. 350+ dedicated employees. Hand-selects premium fruits and vegetables with custom repacking to specifications. Offers bagging, overwraps, labeling, fresh daily. SQF Level 3 Version 7.2 Certified, HAACP Compliant, Kosher. Next-day delivery. Serves wholesale, retail, and foodservice customers across seven states.

name: Muzzarelli Farms (Arkansas Operations)
notes: New Jersey-based producer with wholesale operations serving Arkansas. Growing, packing, shipping and wholesale distribution. Currently accepting bulk orders for 2025 growing season. Email: cmuzzarelli1037@gmail.com. Alternative phone: (856) 207-1037

name: Lexington Produce Terminal
notes: Major produce terminal facility serving central Kentucky region

name: Warren County Produce Cooperative
notes: Cooperative packing facility for local produce growers in Warren County area

name: Kentucky Apple Association Member Facilities
notes: Multiple packing facilities across Eastern Kentucky for apple processing and packing. Check with Kentucky Apple Association for specific member locations.

name: Homestead Seed Company (Historical)
notes: Historic Kentucky seed and produce facility. Verify current operations status.

name: Kentucky Department of Agriculture - Produce Safety Program
phone: Contact KDA for licensed facility directory
notes: Contact Kentucky Department of Agriculture for complete, official directory of all licensed produce packinghouses and handlers. Maintain current licenses required.

metadata.title: Minnesota Produce Packinghouses and Fresh Produce Handlers
metadata.data_source: Minnesota Department of Agriculture, Public Records
metadata.notes: This list represents facilities identified from public sources. Minnesota does not maintain a publicly available comprehensive packinghouse directory. Many facilities may not be listed as they are not required to be public. For complete current list, contact MDA Licensing.

packinghouses.name: Minnesota Department of Agriculture - Licensing Database
packinghouses.notes: Online licensing lookup system displays all MDA licensed wholesale food handlers and produce packinghouses. Search by facility name, city, county, or license type. This is the primary resource for finding current licensed facilities.

packinghouses.name: MDA Fruit and Vegetable Inspection Program
packinghouses.notes: USDA-federally licensed inspection and audit program. Provides market inspections, processed inspections at local facilities, shipping point inspections, and GAP/GHP food safety audits for growers, shippers, receivers, and packers.

packinghouses.name: Minnesota Wholesale Produce Dealer Program
packinghouses.notes: Licenses wholesale businesses that buy produce directly from farmers and re-sell or distribute farmers' produce. Managed by Farm Products Dealers Trust program.

packinghouses.name: Minnesota Co-Packer Directory
packinghouses.notes: Directory of 80+ co-packers (contract manufacturers) in Minnesota and nearby states. Includes facilities offering produce processing, specialty processing (spray-drying, freezing, canning), and value-added produce products.

packinghouses.name: Minnesota Farmers' Market Association
packinghouses.notes: Network organization supporting local food producers and farmers' markets. Can provide referrals to produce handlers and packers serving local food systems.

wholesale_food_handler_license.description: Required for operations that hold, store, sell, and/or distribute food to other businesses from permanent location or mobile units
wholesale_food_handler_license.application_process: Contact MDA, determine area inspector, arrange in-person inspection

wholesale_produce_dealer_license.description: For businesses buying produce directly from farmers and re-selling or distributing for commission

potatoes.notes: Minnesota major potato producing state. Daily inspections at local processing facilities for raw potatoes and sweet potatoes. Mandatory certification for Canadian shipments.
potatoes.inspection_service: Available through MDA Fruit and Vegetable Inspection Program

sweet_corn.notes: Minnesota produces significant sweet corn volumes. Processing facilities and packers serve regional and national markets.
sweet_corn.inspection_service: Market and processing facility inspections available

apples.notes: Minnesota apple production with packing and storage facilities. Many with regional distribution.

search_instructions.step_2: Select 'Food Licenses' category from the licensing programs
search_instructions.step_3: Search for 'Wholesale Food Handler' license type to find produce packinghouses
search_instructions.step_4: Filter by city, county, or region to find specific facilities
search_instructions.step_5: Alternative: Contact MDA Licensing directly at 651-201-6062 or mda.licensing@state.mn.us for current facility list

data_limitations.no_public_directory: Minnesota does not publish a comprehensive public packinghouse directory
data_limitations.private_facilities: Some packing operations may not require state licensing if they meet exemptions
data_limitations.contact_required: Most detailed facility information requires direct contact with MDA or individual businesses
data_limitations.recommendation: For complete current list of licensed facilities, use MDA Online Licensing Lookup or contact MDA Licensing department directly

name: Glacier Fresh Cherries
notes: Family-owned cherry orchard and custom packing house. Largest exporter of cherries in Montana. Packs cherries from approximately 115 acres (55 owned, 60 for other growers). Operates since 2005 for custom packing.

name: Flathead Lake Cherry Growers, Inc.
notes: Cooperative of approximately 70 cherry growers around Flathead Lake. Main packing facility operates on South Finley Point Road near Polson. Operated by Monson Fruit Company. Ships cherries from over 80 Flathead Lake orchards. Cherries shipped primarily to Selah, Washington for packaging and national/international distribution.

name: Mission Mountain Food Enterprise Center
notes: 13,000 sq ft shared-use food processing facility. FDA registered, USDA meat inspected, Certified Organic. Processes pitted sweet Flathead cherries, butternut squash cubes, roasted pie pumpkin puree, blanched green beans, diced onions, diced peppers, shredded zucchini, shredded carrots, cut carrot coins, cubed melons, bell pepper rings, cut cucumbers. Offers cherry pitting, dry mixing, packaging, labeling, and co-packing services. Operating since 2000.

name: Western Montana Growers Cooperative
address: 1500 Burns Street STE C, Missoula, MT 59802
notes: Farmer-owned cooperative with 30+ members and dozens of local/regional producers. Provides marketing, selling, packaging, and delivery of member produce. Delivers to 20+ sites in Western Montana from Missoula to Polson to Helena. Handles fresh/frozen vegetables, fresh/frozen fruits, and prepared foods.

name: Shelby Elevator (Ardent Mills)
notes: Grain elevator facility operated by Ardent Mills. Predominantly supports chickpea processing by loading farmer-delivered chickpeas onto rail cars for shipment to Washington processing facilities. Also handles wheat and grain operations.

name: New Century Ag - Westby Location
notes: Grain handling facility. Handles durum wheat, spring wheat, canola, peas, and lentils. Provides agronomy services including chemical, seed, inoculant, and fertilizer sales. Part of larger New Century Ag network.

name: Cream of the West
notes: Co-packing facility specializing in dry mixes, flour, grains, and tea products. Licensed Montana co-packer.

name: Montana Cookie Company
notes: Co-packing facility specializing in gluten-free cookies and snacks.

name: West Fork Creations
notes: Co-packing facility specializing in chocolate sauces and related products.

name: Roots Kitchen & Cannery
notes: Small-batch food manufacturing and canning co-packing facility. Provides commercial kitchen facilities for food preservation and processing.

name: Muzzarelli Farms
notes: Fourth-generation family operation, 350 acres, Primus Certified, non-GMO, solar-powered facility, supplies 30+ states including NYC, Boston, Philadelphia, LA

name: Atlantic Blueberry Company
notes: One of largest blueberry producers, 750+ acres, five fresh packing lines, PrimusGFS certified, family-owned 85+ years, also at 6200 Black Horse Pike, Mays Landing (609) 625-1154

name: D'Ottavio Produce
notes: Three climate-controlled coolers (50,000+ package capacity), 60x100 cooler, satellite irrigation, forced air cooling, picks/packs/ships within 12 hours, E&A Trucking subsidiary with 20+ tractors

name: Consalo Family Farms
notes: Family-owned grower, packer, shipper, importer, distributor, locations in Vineland, Newfield, Hammonton, Egg Harbor City, custom packaging and private label options

name: Dandrea Produce, LLC
notes: Established 1917, 150+ employees, grower-distributor with vertical integration, year-round fresh produce supply

name: Whalen Farms LLC
notes: 180 acres blueberries, 125 acres cranberry bogs, 395 acres conservation land, state-of-the-art packing facility, IPM (Integrative Pest Management), since 1985

name: American Cranberry Co.
notes: Family-owned producer and distributor in NJ Pinelands, custom packing/repacking services, wholesale boxes and bulk totes

name: Eastern Propak
notes: State-of-the-art cold storage and packing facility, Primus GFS and Organic certified, USDA cold treatment certified, 24/7 cold chain monitoring, forced air cooling, bar coding, RF tracking

name: JSM Blueberries LLC
notes: Owned by Sharon and Joe Montalbano (former Newark firefighter), established 2005, Jersey Fruit cooperative member, started with 10 acres in 1985

name: Glossy Fruit Farms
notes: Fifth-generation family farm established 1887, 500 acres, on-site farm market, Jersey Fruit member, blueberries start around June 12

name: Stoney Creek Blueberries
notes: Established 1970, family-owned 3 generations, 155 acres, 100% solar energy since 2011, drip irrigation (50% less water), state-of-the-art equipment, rigorous farm audits

name: Big Buck Farms LLC
notes: Certified organic and kosher, family-owned 25+ years, NOFA-NJ member, packs under Little Buck brand, Sunny Valley International exclusive sales/marketing, Jersey Fruit member

name: LoSasso Farms
notes: Family-owned since 1956, 21 acres, drip irrigation system, Jersey Fruit cooperative member

name: Pine Island Cranberry Co., Inc.
notes: Owned by Haines and Haines, Inc., 1,400 acres (largest cranberry farm in NJ), produces average 13 million pounds annually

name: Jersey Fruit Cooperative
notes: Established 1940, premier fruit marketing cooperative, member growers in Hammonton, Shamong, Egg Harbor City, Glassboro, Mullica Hill

name: Summer Wind Farms
notes: Certified organic Jersey Fresh vegetables, pickup at farm packing house north of Vineland

name: Cuttler Produce NJ
notes: One of largest wholesale produce warehouses in NJ, refrigerated delivery vehicles

notes: Last independent, family-owned and operated Texas citrus packing house. Established in 2007.

name: Growers Select Produce Inc
notes: Founded in 1987. Year-round watermelon operation. Grows, packs, and ships seedless watermelon 52 weeks a year. All farms and facilities are third-party certified.

name: Rio Fresh
notes: Third-generation, family-owned business. Farming for over 75 years. Over 30 varieties of fresh Texas greens, herbs, and onions. State-of-the-art packing facility.

description: Grower-packer-shipper of premium onions; acquired Baker & Murakami Produce in April 2025; operates advanced facility known locally as 'super shed'
Grows onions in the heart of the Idaho-Eastern Oregon growing region with offices and packing facility located in Parma
Onion shipping and marketing firm; acquired in late 2023; installed equipment for 2-, 3-, and 5-pound consumer packs with new palletizer
Largest grower, packer, and shipper of Vidalia Sweet Onions in the United States; family-owned and operated for over 75 years; known for mild and sweet flavor profile
One of the largest onion packaging & shipping companies; family-owned business
